result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Denell Watkins

defendant.name: Watkins, Anthony Denell
defendant.address: 8924 W Mill Road Unit 7, Milwaukee, WI 53225

records.addlTxt: Assessment for attorney fees and costs in the amount of $890.00 entered as ordered by the court on 9/28/22 to pay $30.00 monthly. Final due payment due by 4/1/25.  Failure to pay is a civil judgment.  sb
Affidavit and order for payment of attorney fees and costs due from Milwaukee County signed.  Filed by:    THOMAS E HARRIS  $890.00
and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs, signed and filed

Defendant Anthony Denell Watkins in court.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Anthony Denell Watkins.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO COUNT 1:  On state's motion, Court ordered charge AMENDED to Disorderly Conduct, Co. Ord. 63.01 to which defendant pled no contest.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered defendant to pay a forfeiture of $100.00 inclusive of all costs and surcharges by 11/21/2022.  In lieu of payment, Court will allow defendant to complete 15 hours of community service with a non-profit organization.  Failure to pay/complete community service will result in a civil judgment.

Defendant Anthony Denell Watkins in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony Denell Watkins appeared by video means with Attorney.
Defense counsel has received discovery and is waiting to receive an offer and requests additional time to review. Defense counsel informed the Court that this may resolve on a municipal level. 
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Anthony Denell Watkins in court.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court conducted indigency hearing and appointed Atty. Thomas Harris to represent defendant at County expense and at the rate of $100.00/hour.  Court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $30/month commencing 11/1/2022 and on the 1st of each month until paid in full to convert to a civil judgment.  Appointment of Attorney at County Expense signed and filed.  Case is adjourned to Br. 37.  Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Anthony Denell Watkins in court without counsel.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court ordered case adjourned for indigency hearing in Branch 37.  Indigency hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Denell Watkins in court.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Matter set for pretrial conference.  Defendant is not eligible for a SPD and would like to represent himself.  Court ordered matter adjourned for an in-person hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 37.  Hearing scheduled on 6/21/22 at 10:30.

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony Denell Watkins
Current: 8924 W Mill Road Unit 7, Milwaukee, WI 53225 United States  (Effective: 04-19-2022)
Prior: 11513 West Brown Deer Road, Milwaukee, WI 53224

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (4-21-2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Court ordered no contact with SK and MM. 
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Anthony Denell Watkins in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/19/22 @ 2p
